intro: Draba olgae, commonly known as the Olgan whitlow grass, is a small, flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, often appearing in clusters at the top of the stems. Draba olgae is a perennial species that produces a basal rosette of leaves and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
